page.title: 07Wildlife of Powburn Area
page.content:
Our area is rich in wild life.The most common wild animals are the fox, rabbit and hare. Roe deer, Cheviot goat, badger and the red squirrel are probably the most rewarding wild animals to look out for.
In addition to the very common birds you might also be lucky enough to see a kestrel or a shorteared owl. The curlew and the 'peewit' can be seen and heard over the moorland.
Foxglove, harebell,meadow sweet pineappleweed and common ragwort are some of the flowers that you might see in our block of land.
We have quite a lot of pipistrelle bats in our area. This bat has a 28cm wingspan.
